text: the BBC understands that those three
girls who were taken from Turkey have
been taken into Syria four or five days
ago by people smugglers sources inside
Syria have told the BBC the girls
crossed the Kilis border crossing and
the three were identified as British one
was said to be wearing glasses this copy
just sent around the BBC newsroom by my
colleague Jonathan Patterson our
deployment editor for BBC World News
gathering so we didn't know we knew the
girls had travelled to Turkey we knew
there was a possibility they may have
traveled into Syria to join Islamic
state now confirmation coming from
sources inside Turkey that they have
indeed made that journey across the
border what we know Hugh is this BBC
journalists here in Turkey have spoken
to a number of contacts on sources on
both sides of the border in Turkey and
in Syria and those contacts and sources
are telling us that four or five days
ago people smugglers a network of people
smugglers took across the border three
girls who were identified as British
including one girl who wore glasses now
I should stress that the contacts and
sources we've been speaking to have not
had access to the passports of those
girls who crossed the border so we
cannot confirm those identities but
nevertheless that's the information that
we're getting which we think is very
important to them
